titleStmt.title: The seaman's compass: or A dainty new ditty composed and pend the deeds of brave seamen to praise and commend twas made by a maid that to Gravesend did pass, now mark and you quickly shall hear how it was. To the tune of The tyrant hath stolen.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clark,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: L.P. (i.e., Laurence Price).
Place of publication from Wing, which suggests 1674-1679 as publication date.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
